sentences.text: PROPOSAL II SUBMITTED FOR YOUR VOTE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TIFICATION OF THE APPOINTMENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR the proposal set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee of Comerica has selected Ernst & Young LLP (Ernst & Young), our independent registered public accounting firm, to audit our financial statements for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017, and recommends that the shareholders vote for ratification of such appointment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young has served as our independent registered public accounting firm since 1992.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has carefully considered the selection of Ernst & Young as Comericas independent registered public accounting firm, and has also considered whether there should be regular rotation of the independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In conjunction with the mandated rotation of the independent registered public accounting firms lead engagement partner, the Audit Committee and its Chairman are involved in the process for selecting Ernst & Youngs new lead engagement partner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This rotation process recently occurred, with a new individual assuming the role of lead engagement partner in 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The members of the Audit Committee believe that the continued retention of Ernst & Young to serve as Comericas independent registered public accounting firm is in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a matter of good corporate governance, the selection of Ernst & Young is being submitted to the shareholders for ratification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a negative vote on such ratification, the Audit Committee will reconsider its selection.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if Ernst & Young is ratified as Comericas independent registered public accounting firm by the shareholders, the Audit Committee, in its discretion, may direct the appointment of a different independent registered public accounting firm at any time during the year if it determines that such a change would be in the best interests of Comerica and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of Ernst & Young are expected to be present at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders and will have the opportunity to make a statement if they so desire.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The representatives also are expected to be available to respond to appropriate questions from shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AUDIT COMMITTEE REPORT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee oversees Comericas financial reporting process on behalf of the Board of Directors and is comprised of all outside directors who are independent within the meaning of, and meet the experience requirements of, the applicable rules of the New York Stock Exchange and the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to its duties regarding oversight of Comericas financial reporting process, including as it relates to the integrity of the financial statements, the independent registered public accounting firms qualifications and independence and the performance of the independent registered public accounting firm and Comericas internal audit function, the Audit Committee also has sole authority to appoint or replace the independent registered public accounting firm and is directly responsible for the compensation and oversight of the work of the independent registered public accounting firm as provided in Rule 10A-3 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee charter, which was adopted and approved by the Board, specifies the scope of the Audit Committees responsibilities and the manner in which it carries out those responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has primary responsibility for the financial statements, reporting processes and system of internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fulfilling its oversight responsibilities, among other things, the Audit Committee reviewed and discussed the audited financial statements included in Comericas Annual Report on Form 10-K with management and the independent registered public accounting firm, including a discussion of the quality, not just the acceptability, of the accounting principles, reasonableness of significant judgments, and clarity of disclosures in the financial statements and a discussion of related controls, procedures, compliance and other matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has discussed with the independent registered public accounting firm the matters required to be discussed by the statement on Auditing Standards No. 1301, Communications with Audit Committees, as adopted by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also has received the written disclosures and the letter from the independent accountant required by applicable requirements of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board regarding the independent accountants communications with the Audit Committee concerning independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee discussed with the independent registered public accounting firm their independence from management and Comerica, and reviewed and considered whether the provision of non-audit services and receipt of certain compensation by the independent registered public accounting firm are compatible with maintaining the independent registered public accounting firms independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: APPROVAL OF A NON-BINDING, ADVISORY PROPOSAL APPROVING EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR the proposal set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Governance, Compensation and Nominating Committee annually reviews Comericas compensation programs to ensure that they demonstrate a strong pay for performance link, reflect good governance and are consistent with appropriate industry practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These programs are described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section, the compensation tables and the related narrative discussion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As outlined in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section, our compensation programs are structured to align the interests of our executives with the nterests of our shareholders, to attract, retain and motivate superior executive talent; to provide a competitive advantage within the banking ndustry; to create a framework that delivers pay commensurate with financial results over the short and long-term; and to reduce incentives for unnecessary and excessive risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board strongly supports Comericas executive pay practices and, as required pursuant to Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, asks shareholders to support its executive compensation program by approving the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the shareholders of Comerica Incorporated approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of Comericas named executive officers, as disclosed pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K and Section 14(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, compensation tables and narrative discussion in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because your vote on this proposal is advisory, it will not be binding on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Governance, Compensation and Nominating Committee will take into account the outcome of the vote when considering future executive compensation arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following our shareholders recommendation in 2011 that we hold an annual vote on our executive compensation, the Board determined to hold an advisory vote on executive compensation every year until our shareholders voted again on the frequency of this advisory vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Proposal IV below, shareholders will again have the ability to vote on the frequency of the advisory vote (every one, two or three years).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we maintain our current frequency, it is anticipated that shareholders will have the ability to vote again on a proposal to approve executive compensation next year at our 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BUSINESS HIGHLIGHTS FOR 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was a pivotal year with the development and launch of an enterprise-wide efficiency and revenue initiative (GEAR Up).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Significant progress was made in executing the expense savings, and we are fully committed to delivering the efficiency and revenue opportunities to further enhance our profitability and shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Comerica benefited from increased interest rates, and while credit metrics remained strong, we substantially increased the reserve allocated for energy loans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some of our significant accomplishments in 2016 included : 1
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achieved earnings per share of $2.68, including restructuring charges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excluding GEAR Up related restructuring charges, earnings per share increased 6%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grew average loans by over $1 billion, or 2%, excluding $641 million reduction in energy loans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grew average noninterest-bearing deposits by $1.7 billion, or 6%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increased net interest income by 6% to $1.8 billion, primarily the result of higher interest rates, loan growth and a larger securities portfolio.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strong credit quality continued with 32 basis points of net charge-offs, which is at the low end of our historical norm, and, excluding the energy line of business, net charge-offs were only 13 basis points.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Drove a 2% increase in customer-driven fees, with a large increase in card fees, as well as growth in fiduciary, foreign exchange and brokerage fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Delivered more than $25 million in expense savings through our GEAR Up initiatives, as planned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overall, reduced non-interest expense by $23 million after excluding restructuring charges of $93 million, as well as a $33 million release of litigation reserves in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increased buybacks under the equity repurchase program by 25% and increased the quarterly dividend 7%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through the buyback and dividends, returned $458 million, or 96%, of 2016 net income to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increased book value per share to $44.47 and increased tangible book value per share to $40.79, as we continue to focus on creating long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock price increased 63%, outperforming all peers as well as every bank in the KBW Index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the S&P 500 Index Comerica was the best-performing financial stock and among the top 10 performers overall.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSR, which includes price appreciation and dividends paid, for the one-, three- and five-year period was 66%, 51% and 188% respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Balances as of December 31, 2016, as compared to December 31, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION HIGHLIGHTS FOR 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use our executive compensation programs to align the interests of executive officers with the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our programs are designed to attract, retain, and motivate leadership to sustain our competitive advantage in the financial sector, and to provide a framework that encourages outstanding financial results and shareholder returns over the long-term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation philosophy and objectives directly influence our pay practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key compensation highlights for 2016 include the follow
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Reviewed compensation plans to ensure market competitiveness and alignment of performance measures with corporate goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation programs for 2016 were consistent with 2015 and included:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A three-year performance share program where payouts are contingent on the achievement of specific prospective financial goals and include a negative modifier in the case of bottom quartile relative TSR performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A short-term cash incentive program that measures absolute performance as opposed to relative peer performanc
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A long-term cash incentive program based on performance relative to peers, with no payout in the bottom quartile    A forfeiture provision applicable to all equity awards granted in 2014 or later that allows for the cancellation of unvested equity awards in the event of an adverse risk outcome
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Eliminated 2016 annual merit increases for the CEO, the President and the former Vice Chair and CFO in light of the challenging operating environment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Expanded the clawback policy to include all senior officer positions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Redesigned Comericas retirement programs to create a revised structure that remains competitive and is sustainable for the long-term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Took a balanced approach to annual incentives by using negative discretion to ensure that participants did not receive additional benefits related to cost savings in connection with the GEAR Up initiative, while adjusting for the impact of restructuring charges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Decisions for the 2016 Performance Period
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SHAREHOLDER OUTREACH
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder outreach is an integral part of Comericas business practices, as shareholders provide insight on a variety of topics, including operations, governance and compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to discussing industry matters and Comericas performance, we receive feedback frequently from our investors at investor conferences, which we participate in at least quarterly, and during periodic office visits at investors offices or our Dallas headquarters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the past several years, in the first and fourth quarters, Comerica has solicited the input from shareholders specifically aimed at supporting an ongoing dialogue to address governance, compensation and other topics of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, as is our customary practice, we reached out to our top 25 shareholders, which hold approximately 54% of our shares, as well as a number of additional shareholders who expressed an interest in providing feedback or who had provided feedback in the past.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, shareholders continued to be supportive of our compensation structure and indicated their support for maintaining these programs for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximately 85% of our shareholders voted for our 2016 Say On Pay proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of the strong shareholder support and the restructuring activities and business initiatives undertaken in 2016, no significant changes are being contemplated for 2017 at this time, other than the redesign of Comericas retirement programs effective January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the section below titled 2017 Retirement Programs for details on the new programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both the Governance, Compensation and Nominating Committee (the Committee) and management conducted thorough reviews of the programs and were comfortable that the current programs meet our objectives to ensure the compensation programs demonstrate a strong pay for performance linkage, reflect good governance and are consistent with appropriate industry practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of their review, the Committee and management acknowledged that the current plan structure holds all of the executive officers accountable for successfully executing the GEAR Up initiative as part of their performance reviews.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, keeping the program structure in place for a fourth year allows consistency for participants, which is important in light of all the organizational transformations that took place over 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nevertheless, the Committee will evaluate plan designs to gain more insight for potential changes for 2018 to further support the GEAR Up initiative.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will continue to consider shareholder feedback, as well as evolving executive compensation practices and regulatory requirements, in the future when designing executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Philosophy and Objectives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use our executive compensation programs to align the interests of executive officers with the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our programs are designed to attract, retain and motivate leadership to sustain our competitive advantage in the financial sector, and to provide a framework that encourages outstanding financial results and shareholder returns over the long-term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally strive to set target compensation opportunities near the median of our peer group, with actual payouts in respect of variable compensation dependent on performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We utilize a mix of variable compensation programs that measure long-term and short-term results with rewards delivered in cash and shares of Comericas stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This balanced approach towards compensation supports our business strategies, aligns with our pay for performance philosophy, and is reinforced through sound compensation governance to mitigate excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PRACTICES What We Do Have:   What We Dont Have:        Clawback policy in addition to Sarbanes-Oxley requirements          Employment agreements*        Forfeiture policy which the Committee can utilize in the event of adverse risk outcomes to cancel all or part of outstanding, unvested stock awards          Excise tax gross-up payments for change of control agreements entered into after 2008, and Comerica will not include this provision in future agreements        Stock ownership guidelines for both senior executives and the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO is expected to own 6X his salary, the President 4X his salary and the NEOs 3X their salary; directors have a 5,000 share holding expectation          Modified single trigger severance for change of control agreements entered into after 2008, and Comerica will not include this provision in future agreements        Independent compensation consultant who works solely for the Committee and performs no other work for Comerica          Repricing or replacing of underwater stock options or SARs without shareholder approval        Prohibition on pledging or hedging shares by employees or directors          Perquisites, which were eliminated for executive officers in 2010        Post vesting holding requirement for directors.

sentences.text: ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Compensation Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is responsible for overseeing the development and administration of our compensation programs, is comprised of independent directors, and reviews and approves all aspects of our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To aid the Committee in satisfying its responsibilities, the Committee retained Frederic W. Cook & Co.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Inc., (Cook & Co.) in June of 2013 to act as ts independent consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cook & Co. reports directly to the Committee and performs no other work for Comerica.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its annual review of Cook & Co. in 2016, the Committee analyzed if hiring Cook & Co. would raise a conflict of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee performed this analysis by taking nto consideration the following factors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any other services provided to Comerica by Cook & Co.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of fees Cook & Co. received from Comerica
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policies and procedures Cook & Co. utilizes to prevent conflicts of interest   Any business or personal relationship of the individual compensation advisor of Cook & Co. with any member of the Committee or an executive officer of Comerica
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any Comerica stock owned by Cook & Co. or the Committees individual advisor   Any business or personal relationship of Cook & Co. with an executive officer of Comerica
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the Committees evaluation of Cook & Co.s independence, Comerica did not pay any fees to Cook & Co. in 2016 other than in connection with work performed for the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the analysis, Cook & Co.s primary representative to the Committee indicated that fees paid annually to Cook & Co. by Comerica are far less than 1% of Cook & Co.s annual consolidated total revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also discussed with the Committee various policies developed by Cook & Co. to safeguard the independence of the compensation advice it provides; indicated that he has no personal or business relationship with Committee members or executive officers at Comerica; indicated that he is not aware of any personal or business relationship between Comericas executive officers and Cook & Co.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ; and indicated that neither he nor his immediate family members own any Comerica shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee determined, based on its analysis of the above factors that the work of Cook & Co. and the individual compensation advisors employed by Cook & Co. as compensation consultants to the Committee has not presented any conflict of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The goals or metrics used to measure performance were established at the beginning of the year and approved by the Committee.

sentences.text: Each metric is intended to be a robust measurement of performance that is aligned with our financial plan but does not incent excessive risk taking.

sentences.text: Factors such as prior year performance, the forecasted economic and regulatory environment and strategic initiatives are all considered when establishing target performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We selected these metrics because they are commonly used by investors and analysts to evaluate a financial institutions performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, unlike other metrics that may be calculated differently, these metrics have a generally prescribed formula, and may be easily validated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the use of measures that are well understood, transparent and based on the audited financial results of Comerica are the foundation of a responsible incentive program that rewards performance without encouraging participants to take excessive risk.

sentences.text: Forfeiture Provisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure our equity incentives do not encourage excessive risk taking, a forfeiture provision was adopted beginning with the 2014 grants that allows for the Committee to cancel all or a portion of any unvested awards (SELTPP, stock options or RSAs) if the participant fails to comply with Comerica policies or procedures, violates any law or regulations, engages in negligent or willful misconduct, engages in activity resulting in a significant or material Sarbanes-Oxley control deficiency or demonstrates poor risk management or lack of judgment in the discharge of Company duties, and such action demonstrates an inadequate sensitivity to the inherent risks of the participants division and results in or is likely to result in a material impact (financial or reputational) to Comerica.

sentences.text: OTHER BENEFITS PROGRAMS AND COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Comerica offers all of its employees benefit programs that provide protection for health, welfare and retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These programs are typical at most companies and include healthcare, life insurance, disability, dental and vision insurance and relocation benefits, as well as an employee stock purchase program and retirement programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee Stock Purchase Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees can participate in an Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), which provides participants a convenient and affordable way to purchase shares of Comerica common stock without being charged a brokerage fee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Comerica provides a match on qualifying contributions provided the employee does not make any withdrawals during the applicable time period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees can receive a 15% quarterly match and a 5% annual match, with total match dollars capped at $5,000 per employee per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This encourages stock ownership for all colleagues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STOCK OWNERSHIP GUIDELINES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have stock ownership guidelines that encourage senior officers, including the NEOs, to own a significant amount of Comerica stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stock ownership guidelines are a multiple of annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior officers have five years from the time they are named to a senior leadership position to achieve the targeted ownership levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, after five years, the individual does not meet the ownership guideline, he/she will be required to retain 50% of all after-tax shares from RSA vestings or stock option exercises.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Internal Grade Level         Salary Multiple CEO       6X President       4X EVP (Level II)       3X EVP (Level I)       2X SVP        1X
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Utilizing stock ownership guidelines helps to align leadership with shareholder interests and to reinforce focus on the long-term success of Comerica.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of the stock ownership guidelines, stock ownership includes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unvested shares of time-based RSAs or restricted stock units;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shares owned by the senior officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares held in trust where the senior officer retains beneficial ownership; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shares accumulated through employee benefit plans, such as deemed investments in Comerica common stock under a deferred compensation plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SELTPP shares are not counted towards ownership until they are vested and shares are distributed to the participants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, all active NEOs who have held their current title for at least five years have met their respective stock ownership guideline levels.

sentences.text: EMPLOYMENT CONTRACTS AND SEVERANCE OR CHANGE OF CONTROL AGREEMENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change of Control Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain change of control agreements with all of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change of control agreements are customary in the banking industry and among our peers and aid us in attracting and retaining executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The goal of these agreements is to make an executive neutral to any change of control by reducing personal uncertainty.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, they encourage continuity in management through the completion of a transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a change of control of Comerica occurs, each NEO will have a right to continued employment for a period of 30 months from the date of the change of control (the Employment Period).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the executive dies or becomes disabled during the Employment Period, the executive or his or her beneficiary will receive accrued obligations, including salary, pro rata bonus, deferred compensation and vacation pay, and death or disability benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Comerica terminates the executives employment for a reason other than cause or disability, or the executive terminates for good reason during the Employment Period, the agreement provides the following severance benefits (Change of Control Benefits):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any unpaid base salary through the date of termination;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a proportionate bonus based upon the highest annual bonus he or she earned during any of the last three fiscal years prior to the change of control or during the most recently completed fiscal year following the change of control (highest annual bonus);    an amount equal to three times the sum of the executives annual base salary plus the executives highest annual bonus;   a payment equal to the excess of: (a) the retirement benefits he or she would receive under Comericas pension and excess defined benefit
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: plans or Retirement Account Plan, as applicable, if he or she continued to be employed for three years after the date his or her employment was terminated, over (b) the retirement benefits he or she actually accrued under the plans as of the date of termination;   provision of health, accident, disability and life insurance benefits for three years after the executives employment terminates, unless he or she becomes eligible to receive comparable benefits during the three-year period; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: outplacement services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These amounts would be paid in a lump sum with the exception of the health, accident, disability and life insurance benefits and the payment of outplacement services, which would be paid as the expenses were incurred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All payments would be made by Comerica or the surviving entity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change of control agreements entered into in 2008 and before included an excise tax benefit and a window period feature.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, Mr. Babb, Mr. Farmer and Mr. Duprey would also receive the Change of Control Benefits if they resigned for any reason within the 30 days after the one-year anniversary of the change of control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, if any payment or benefit to Mr. Babb, Mr. Farmer or Mr. Duprey under the agreement or otherwise were subject to the excise tax under Section 4999 of the Internal Revenue Code, they would receive an additional payment in an amount sufficient to make the executive whole for any such excise tax.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if such payments (excluding additional amounts payable due to the excise tax) did not exceed 110% of the greatest amount that could be paid without giving rise to the excise tax, no additional payments would be made with respect to the excise tax, and the payments otherwise due to Mr. Babb, Mr. Farmer, or Mr. Duprey would be reduced to an amount necessary to prevent the application of the excise tax.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change of control agreements entered into after 2008 provide that payments and benefits will be reduced to the amount necessary to prevent the application of the excise tax if such reduction would result in the executive retaining a greater amount on a net after-tax basis than if they were not reduced.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DEDUCTIBILITY OF EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is Comericas intention generally to design its executive compensation programs to maximize the deductibility of executive compensation under the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Committee reserves the right in the exercise of its business judgment to establish appropriate compensation levels for executive officers that may exceed the limits on tax deductibility established under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code or not satisfy the performance-based award exception under Section 162(m), and therefore would not be deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participation in the TARP Capital Purchase Program imposed additional limitations under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the TARP period, Comericas deduction for annual compensation for the Section 162(m) covered executives was limited to $500,000 and the performance-based exception of Section 162(m) was not available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, certain portions of our executive officers compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: attributable to services during our TARP participation period (November 14, 2008 to March 17, 2010) may not be deductible when paid.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such additional deductibility limitations ceased with respect to compensation earned after Comericas redemption on March 17, 2010 of the preferred stock issued under the TARP Capital Purchase Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate nondeductible portion of cash compensation paid or earned with respect to 2016 performance and of any value received in 2016 from prior equity awards is estimated to be approximately $4.5 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary component of this nondeductible compensation is the value of RSAs granted in prior years that vested in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At a 35% federal tax rate, the aggregate cost to Comerica associated with the inability to deduct this compensation in 2016 is approximately $1.6 million, or approximately $0.009 per share outstanding as of December 31, 2016.

sentences.text: STOCK GRANTING POLICY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Comericas stock-based grants are governed by the Stock Granting Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, the policy states that annual stock-based grants to eligible employees will be made once per year during the first regularly scheduled meeting of the Committee in a calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This meeting typically takes place toward the end of January.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Stock Granting Policy also governs the granting of off-cycle awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Off-cycle awards include such things as grants to new hires and grants for retention purposes or special recognition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to grants made to newly hired employees, the grant date is typically determined based on their start date with Comerica.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, individuals who start employment during the first half of the month will receive their grant on the last day of that month, and individuals who start employment during the last half of the month will receive their grant on the 15th day of the subsequent month.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In all cases, the grant date will be adjusted if the prescribed date is not a trading day for the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price of stock options is the closing price of Comericas stock on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other off-cycle awards are normally approved at a regularly scheduled meeting of the Committee, and the grant date is the date of the Committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the CEO may make off-cycle option grants to existing employees who are not executive officers for promotions and for retention purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such option grants are made on the same schedule as off-cycle grants approved by the Committee and may not exceed 5,000 shares per individual per calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CLAWBACK POLICIES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Comerica has the following clawback policies and provisions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recoupment policy in response to the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (the Dodd-Frank Act) and shareholder feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The recoupment policy provides that in the event we are required to prepare an accounting restatement of our financial statements due to material noncompliance with any financial reporting requirement under the securities laws, the Board will require reimbursement or forfeiture of certain incentive-based compensation received by any current or former executive officer during the three- year period preceding the date on which the accounting restatement is required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The clawback pertains to any excess income derived by a senior or executive officer based on materially inaccurate accounting statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: senior or executive officer based on materially inaccurate accounting statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback provision of the Sarbanes Oxley Act of 2002, which generally requires our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer to reimburse us for any bonus or other incentive- or equity-based compensation and any profits on sales of Comerica stock that they receive within the 12-month period following the issuance of financial information if there is an accounting restatement because of material noncompliance, as a result of misconduct, with any financial reporting requirement under the federal securities laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: noncompliance, as a result of misconduct, with any financial reporting requirement under the federal securities laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback provisions of our shareholder-approved 2006 LTIP, which provide that the Committee has the express right to cancel an option or RSA grant if the Committee determines in good faith that the recipient has engaged in conduct harmful to Comerica, such as having: (i) committed a felony;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) embezzled;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) disclosed confidential information or trade secrets;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) been terminated for cause;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) engaged in any activity in competition with our business or the business of any of our subsidiaries or affiliates; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vii) engaged in conduct that adversely affected Comerica.

sentences.text: COMPENSATION POLICIES AND PROCEDURES THAT AFFECT RISK MANAGEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2011, Comerica, similar to other large banking organizations, has been subject to a continuing review of incentive compensation policies and practices by regulatory bodies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In our case, this has included representatives of the Federal Reserve Board, the Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas and the Texas Department of Banking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of that review, we have undertaken a thorough analysis of all the incentive compensation programs hroughout the organization, the individuals covered by each plan and the risks inherent in each plans design and implementation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use incentive ompensation plans as part of the total reward package for a significant number of employees, as well as our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this section, we describe some of our policies regarding use and management of incentive compensation plans, and how we manage risks arising from the use of ncentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Consider Risk When Structuring Incentive Compensation Programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some risk-taking is an inherent part of operating a business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, we strive to embed a culture of risk management throughout Comerica.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs are designed to encourage management of risk and discourage inappropriate risk-taking by utilizing a diverse portfolio of incentive compensation programs and risk balancing mechanisms for our executives and other senior employees that is expected to reward the desired behavior and results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To appropriately allocate risk, we use incentives differently, based on job type.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, our NEOs and senior officers participate in the MIP, which is the vehicle that provided the AEI and LTEI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participating employees generally have broader, Comerica-wide and/or strategic responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, MIP award funding is based on corporate performance (adjusted EPS and adjusted ROA).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other employees participate in incentive plans designed to support the business objectives of the line of business in which they reside, such as commission plans that measure sales and customer satisfaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Identify Potential Risks Arising from Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through Board Review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee, at least annually, reviews the structure and components of our compensation arrangements, the material potential sources of risk in our business lines and compensation arrangements, and various policies and practices of Comerica that mitigate this risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Within this framework, the Committee discusses the parameters of acceptable and excessive risk-taking and the general business goals and concerns of Comerica, including the need to attract, retain and motivate top tier talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the Committee focuses on the risks associated with the design of each plan, particularly higher risk incentive plans, the mitigation factors that exist for each plan, additional factors that could be considered and an overall risk assessment with respect to the plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The risks with regard to employee compensation plans are assessed based on the plan design features and financial impact (i.e., the potential award size) of each plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plan design features that could increase risk, if not for the presence of mitigating factors, have been identified as follows: uncapped sales commissions, plans with significant maximum payouts, and plans without a link to corporate performance or business line results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our plans have links to corporate or business line results that allow for funding to be adjusted downward, and our governance procedures ensure awards are reviewed for appropriateness before they are distributed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: strengthened around incentive administration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A detailed review was conducted in 2014 for 2015 plan design, and Towers Watsons report (which was reviewed and approved by Comericas risk management leadership) indicated that none of our 2015 plans appeared to be structured in a manner that would encourage behavior that might lead an eligible participant to take excessive business risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The same independent review will be conducted in 2017 for consideration of 2018 plan decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Manage Potential Risks Arising from Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By identifying risk-taking employees throughout the organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using the principles articulated in Federal Reserve guidance, Comerica created a systematic methodology to review our entire population based on their job function and specifically considered the inherent risk associated with each position to identify our risk-taking employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clear identification of the risk takers allows Comerica to ensure their compensation arrangements do not encourage excessive risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By using risk balancing mechanisms when developing incentive plans and allocating awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Several different types of risk balancing
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: guidelines that incorporate the evaluation of risk behaviors for the use of discretion in determining awards for risk-taking employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By maintaining a strong governance process to manage employee compensation plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a Business Unit Incentive Oversight Committee (BUIOC) comprised of executives who, each year, review and approve incentive plans for non-executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The BUIOC was established by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of our executive steering committee are responsible for reviewing incentive awards and/or award components for risk-taking employees that are based on management discretion, ensuring a robust review of incentive plans from design to payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in 2014, a key risk leader working group was established to identify risks throughout the organization which could have an impact on incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Items identified by this group are shared with the CEO and the Committee as appropriate to consider when reviewing recommend incentive awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This helps to ensure we are evaluating compensation on a comprehensive basis and in the context of risk outcomes and behaviors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in 2014 and are explained more fully on page 64.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By using performance measures that include or adjust for risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the MIP, we use performance metrics that are closely correlated to shareholder return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These implicitly include an important risk focus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under other incentive plans, we incorporate risk adjustment tools (such as profitability measures, risk ratings, probability of default, etc.), in addition to performance against strategic goals in determining award amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All plans allow for the cancelation or reduction of funding for unforeseen events that impact the business lines or Comericas results, notwithstanding positive formulaic results to the contrary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By monitoring risk outcomes in the marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to ensure our practices and oversight are strong and to guard against unintended outcomes, we monitor the outcomes of other financial institutions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As issues are identified, our own practices and controls are reviewed to help mitigate risk in our own programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the factors identified above, we have determined that risks arising from Comericas employee compensation plans are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on Comerica.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, it is both the Committees and managements intent to continue to review our plans and procedures going forward by monitoring regulations and best practices with regard to sound incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Pension Plan is a tax-qualified defined benefit pension plan and a consolidation of the former Manufacturers National Corporation Pension Plan, the Comerica Incorporated Retirement Plan and pension plans of other companies acquired by Comerica.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participation in the Pension Plan was redefined in 2011 to include those individuals who are actively accruing benefits in the Pension Plan as of December 22, 2011, which had the effect of eliminating the reentrance of individuals into the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The above retirement programs for active colleagues were revised effective January 1, 2017 and renamed the Retirement Income Account (RIA) Plan and the Supplemental Retirement Income Account (SRIA) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The RIA/SRIA Plans will generally replace the current Pension Plan, SERP and Retirement Account Plan (RAP) with one set of plans for all eligible colleagues going forward.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see the section above titled 2017 Retirement Programs for details on the revised programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Pension Plan provides the following types of benefits:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Early retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Early retirement age under the Pension Plan is 55.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant with 10 years of service may retire at early retirement age, or thereafter, and receive payment of his or her accrued benefit, reduced by an early retirement reduction factor for commencement prior to normal retirement age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, Mr. Duprey and Mr. Faubion were eligible for early retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Faubion retired on January 3, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Normal retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Normal retirement age under the Pension Plan is 65.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, none of the NEOs were eligible for normal retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Late Retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement after age 65, the normal retirement date, is a late retirement under the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant who retires under the late retirement provision will receive a benefit equal to the greater of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a) a benefit calculated using final average pay and service (capped at 35 years) as of the late retirement date and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: b) a benefit, calculated using final average pay and service (capped at 35 years) as of the normal retirement date, actuarially increased to the late retirement date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, Mr. Babb was eligible for late retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vested separated retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After five years of service with Comerica, an eligible employee is vested in the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such an employee receives a vested separated retirement benefit at the time of voluntary termination even if such employee is not eligible for retirement, reduced by a vested separated retirement factor for commencement prior to normal retirement age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, none of the NEOs was eligible for a vested separated retirement benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After attainment of age 50 and fifteen years of service with Comerica, an eligible employee would receive a benefit in the event of total disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, Mr. Babb and Mr. Faubion had satisfied the service requirements for disability benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an eligible employee who has earned a vested accrued benefit dies prior to electing an optional form of benefit, the eligible employees surviving spouse, if any, would receive the same benefit that would be payable if the eligible employee had separated from service on the date of death and elected an immediate joint and 50% survivor annuity as of the date of death or at the earliest retirement age, if later.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An eligible employee who is at least age 50 and has earned a vested accrued benefit may elect an enhanced death benefit that would pay a benefit assuming the eligible employee separated from service on the date of death and elected an immediate joint and 100% survivor annuity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of the NEOs, Mr. Babb and Mr. Faubion have elected an enhanced death benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant may not receive multiple levels of benefits under the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant who retires under the Pension Plan receives a pension comprised of two parts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The first part is the pension based on the service the participant accrued under one of the aforementioned plans on the day prior to the January 1, 1994 merger of those plans into the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The second part is the sum of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) nine-tenths of one percent times the participants final average monthly compensation, times the participants years of benefit service since January 1, 1994 (total service not to exceed 35); plus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) seven tenths of one percent times the participants final average monthly compensation in excess of the participants covered compensation (the average of the taxable wage bases in effect for each calendar year during the 35-year period ending on the last day of the calendar year in which the participant attains Social Security Retirement Age), times the participants years of benefit service since January 1, 1994 (total service not exceeding 30).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Final average monthly compensation is a participants aggregate monthly compensation for the 60 consecutive calendar months that fall within the 120 calendar months preceding the participants retirement or separation from service prior to retirement, which results in the highest aggregate monthly compensation, divided by 60.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation under the Pension Plan is defined as wages, salary (including salary awarded in the form of phantom salary stock units) and any other amounts received for personal service actually rendered in the course of the employees employment with the employer, to the extent such amounts are includible in gross income, plus incentives earned under the MIP, inclusive of awards earned under the MIP that the Committee determines will be paid under Comericas 2006 LTIP in lieu of a cash incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Pension Plan also provides a benefit feature intended to help retiring employees purchase additional health care insurance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is a level benefit to all employees that is not based on compensation but is based on points.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Points are the participants age plus service at termination or retirement not exceeding 100 points.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This benefit provides $1.50 per point payable monthly commencing on the participants normal retirement date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants eligible to retire early under the Pension Plan who have also attained age 60 with 10 years of service or who have accumulated 80 points on or after age 55, are entitled to a benefit equal to $3.00 per point payable monthly commencing on their early retirement date and ending on their normal retirement date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, a participant retiring at age 60 and with 20 years of service would receive a monthly payment of $240 until his or her normal retirement date and a monthly benefit of $120 thereafter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those vested employees not meeting the age 60 and 10 years of service or 80 point criteria would receive a flat $1.50 per point monthly benefit commencing on his or her normal retirement date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In past years, there was some flexibility provided in the IRS regulations to include an additional benefit in the Pension Plan that would otherwise be payable from the SERP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, certain participants in the Pension Plan are entitled to receive an annual benefit that is the greater of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) their normal retirement benefit calculated regularly, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) their normal retirement benefit calculated applying the 2016 compensation limit for earnings after 2016, but adding a stated additional amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEOs who were eligible for the additional benefit under the Pension Plan at December 31, 2016 are: Mr. Babb, with an additional annual benefit of $147,485; Mr. Duprey, with an additional annual benefit of $64,281; and Mr. Faubion, with an additional annual benefit of $124,709.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 limit under the Internal Revenue Code on the maximum annual pension that any participant, including any NEO, may receive under a tax-qualified defined benefit plan is $210,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum annual compensation of any participant that Comerica can consider in computing a pension under a qualified plan is $265,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant who is unmarried at the time of retirement generally receives a pension in the form of a single life annuity, the annual amount of which is listed in the Pension Benefits at Fiscal Year-End 2016 table above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant who is married at the time of retirement generally receives a pension in the form of a joint and 50% survivor annuity, the amount of which is actuarially equivalent to the single life annuity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts set forth in the table above are not subject to deduction for Social Security or other offset amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pension benefit formula unde each of these plans is designed so that the pension benefits payable are integrated with the Social Security taxable wage base.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the Pension Plan, Comerica maintains the SERP, which is a consolidation of the nonqualified retirement plans previously maintained by Comerica and Manufacturers National Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SERP makes up the portion of the retirement benefits lost by participants in the Pension Plan due to limits under the Internal Revenue Code on tax-qualified retirement plans that cap annual compensation which can be taken into account in determining pension benefits, cap the annual benefit that can be paid to any participant and set restrictions when a plan is top-heavy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SERP includes the amount of certain deferrals that are not included within the compensation definition in the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SERP benefits are calculated in the form of a 100% joint and survivor annuity if a participant is married and in the form of a life annuity if a participant is not married when payments commence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SERP also provides the supplemental pension to Mr. Babb that is described in the May 29, 1998 Supplemental Pension and Retiree Medical Agreement between Comerica and Mr. Babb, referenced on page 68 under Employment Contracts and Severance or Change of Control Agreements of the Compensation Discussion and Analysis portion of the proxy statement, which serves to equalize the effect that the departure from his prior employer had on Mr. Babbs pension.

sentences.text: Employee Deferred Compensation Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Comerica maintains two deferred compensation plans for eligible employees of Comerica and its subsidiaries: the 1999 Comerica Incorporated Amended and Restated Common Stock Deferred Incentive Award Plan (the Employee Common Stock Deferral Plan) and the 1999 Comerica Incorporated Amended and Restated Deferred Compensation Plan (the Employee Investment Fund Deferral Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Employee Common Stock Deferral Plan, eligible employees may defer up to 100% of their incentive awards into units that are functionally equivalent to shares of Comerica common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividend payments are converted to an equivalent unit value and credited to the employees account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, the deferred compensation under the Employee Common Stock Deferral Plan is payable in shares of Comerica common stock following termination of service as an employee, over the period elected by the employee, except in the case of termination due to death or separation of service prior to retirement, in which case the deferred compensation is payable in shares of Comerica common stock in a single lump sum distribution within ninety days.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, under the Employee Investment Fund Deferral Plan, eligible employees may defer a portion of their compensation, including up to 60% of salary, and up to 100% of bonus and incentive awards, into units that are functionally equivalent to shares of broad-based mutual funds offered under the Employee Investment Fund Deferral Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These investments are similar to those offered under Comericas Preferred Savings 401(k)) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of 1999, Comerica common stock was no longer an investment choice under the Employee Investment Fund Deferral Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any dividend payments are converted to an equivalent unit value and credited to the employees account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, the deferred compensation under he Employee Investment Fund Deferral Plan is payable in cash following termination of service as an employee, over the period elected by the employee, except in the case of termination due to death or separation of service prior to retirement, in which case the deferred compensation is payable in cash in a single lump sum distribution within ninety days.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL IV SUBMITTED FOR YOUR VOTE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NON-BINDING, ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY THAT SHAREHOLDERS ARE TO BE PRESENTED WITH ADVISORY PROPOSALS APPROVING EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that you vote for ONE YEAR with respect to the proposal set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in Proposal III above, Comericas shareholders are being provided the opportunity to cast an advisory vote on the Companys executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The advisory vote on executive compensation described in Proposal III above is often referred to as a say on pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, we are also required to submit to shareholders an advisory vote on how often Comerica should include a say on pay proposal in its proxy materials for future annual shareholder meetings (or special shareholder meetings for which the Company must include executive compensation information in the proxy statement for that meeting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this Proposal IV, shareholders may vote to recommend that the say on pay vote be held every year, every two years or every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Comerica believes that say on pay votes should be conducted every year so that shareholders may annually express their views on the Companys executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Comericas shareholders have been provided with the opportunity to cast an annual say on pay vote since 2010, and the Governance, Compensation and Nominating Committee, which administers Comericas executive compensation program, values the opinions expressed by shareholders in these votes and will continue to consider the outcome of these votes in making its decisions on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal is set forth in the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the highest number of votes cast by the shareholders of Comerica Incorporated for the option set forth below shall be deemed to be the preferred frequency with which Comerica Incorporated is to hold an advisory vote to approve executive compensation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One year,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Two years or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because your vote on this proposal is advisory, it will not be binding on the Board, and the Board may decide that it is in the best interests of our shareholders and the Company to hold a say on pay vote less frequently, or more frequently, than the option recommended by our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Governance, Compensation and Nominating Committee will take into account the recommendation of shareholders when considering how often to submit to shareholders the say on pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOUSEHOLDING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SEC rules allow a single copy of the proxy materials or the notice of internet availability of proxy materials to be delivered to multiple shareholders sharing the same address and last name, or who we reasonably believe are members of the same family and who consent to receive a single copy of these materials in a manner provided by these rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This practice is referred to as householding and can result in significant savings of paper and mailing costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because we are using the SECs notice and access rule, we will not household our proxy materials or notices to shareholders of record sharing an address.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that shareholders of record who share an address will each be mailed a separate notice or paper copy of the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, we understand that certain brokerage firms, banks, or other similar entities holding our common stock for their customers may household proxy materials or notices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders sharing an address whose shares of our common stock are held by such an entity should contact such entity if they now receive (1) multiple copies of our proxy materials or notices and wish to receive only one copy of these materials per household in the future, or (2) a single copy of our proxy materials or notice and wish to receive separate copies of these materials in the future.
